publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5129 Tommy Sheridan: Stress: Biggest Workplace Problem—That the Parliament notes recent research by the Trades Union Congress indicating that stress is the biggest problem facing workplaces across Britain and that excessive workloads, job cuts, long hours, rapid change and bullying are the biggest contributory factors to rising stress problems among workers and further notes that stress has to be tackled through a legally enforceable shorter working week, to both relieve stress and create more job opportunities.
